image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from South Carolina; born in Charleston, S.C., March 29, 1927; B.S., College of Charleston, 1950; served in the U.S. Marine Corps, 1945-1946; realtor and general contractor; member, South Carolina State house of representatives, 1953-1958; South Carolina State senate, 1980-1986; elected as a Republican to the One Hundredth and to the three succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1987-January 1995); was not a candidate for reelection in 1994, but was an unsuccessful candidate for nomination for Governor of South Carolina; member of the Charleston County school board, 2006-2010; died on January 16, 2023, in Charleston, S.C.; interment at French Huguenot Church Cemetery, Charleston, S.C.

researchRecord.name: 1838-2015, 3 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers of former Congressman Arthur Ravenel include his official papers, as well as those of his family. A finding aid is available in the repository and online.

researchRecord.name: In the James Evan Duffy Papers, 1960-1973, 9.5 cubic feet and 1 folder.
researchRecord.description: Other persons represented include Arthur Ravenel. The finding aid is published in: National Inventory of Documentary Sources in the United States, microfiche 4.6.3 #4.
